channel.title: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)
channel.description:
I have spent over three hours trying to start my own rsc server to no avail because every time i tried to log in it would say "unable to connect". I have used the search button continuously and have followed the steps to putting my i.p. address in the server and system files but I was not able to compile them. I thought the the only thing I needed to do was install jdk (the path was set to jre not jdk) and set it as the path, so I followed the stickied thread that told me to download java se development and now it's even worse than the message that says "unable to connect" because the rsc client doesn't even start up. Even worse, I can't get into the rscemulation client or virtually any rsc client EVEN WHEN I CHANGHE THE PATH BACK TO MY ORIGINAL jre! What can i do?
This was the message I got when trying to compile before java COMPLETELY broke down on me:
[img]http://img175.imageshack.us/img175/2536/63180850.jpg[/img]

item.title: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

You should probably just reinstall java all together. JavaRE (Runetime Enviorment) dosn’t come with Javac (the java compiler).

Read full topic
item.source: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)

item.title: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

check your ip/port settings

If you use localhost for the server you have to use localhost for the client.

Read full topic
item.source: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)

item.title: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)
item.dc:creator: @ninja_Strike ninja_Strike
item.description:
@ninja_Strike wrote:

Ok great, thanks. I’m back to opening my client but I still can’t connect to server. For some bizarre reason every last item in my jdk folder in the java folder has vanished. When I try to use .exe to extract it again it leaves an empty folder. Should I reinstall the .exe application??

Read full topic

item.title: Java is totally Dysfunctioning. (Please don't tell me to use search, I have)
item.dc:creator: @roflcopterofl roflcopterofl
item.description:
@roflcopterofl wrote:

\bin you forgot to add that after \jre1.6.0 in your environment variables

in other words:
c:\program files \java\jre1.6.0\bin

Read full topic
